page.title: 09FLAX BOURTON SCHOOL
page.content: The village school in Flax Bourton was built in 1859. There are 78 children on roll at the present time.These come not only from the village itself but also from Barrow Gurney,Long Ashton and also from Backwell.The school is divided into three classes and is housed on two sites until such time that a new school is built. A wide range of subjects is taught The whole school swims each week at Backwell and this helps to compensate for the lack of facilities at the school.Work is based on various topics which cover all areas of the curriculum. Frequent trips are undertaken to the theatre,concerts and also residential outings to large cities such as London and York.When they leave Flax Bourton most pupils go to Backwell Comprehensive School.
